radiographic_examinations.findings: Visualized portions of the lung bases are clear. The liver, gallbladder, spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands are normal. The kidneys enhance with and excrete contrast symmetrically without evidence of hydronephrosis. No evidence of small or large bowel obstruction. No lymphadenopathy, free air, or free fluid. The bladder, uterus, and rectum appear unremarkable. There is trace free fluid but no lymphadenopathy. The appendix is fluid filled and enlarged, measuring between 8-10 mm, with oral contrast seen entering the early portion. The appendiceal tip appears hyperenhancing, with minimal surrounding fat stranding. A few prominent mesenteric lymph nodes are noted in the right lower quadrant. No aggressive-appearing lytic or sclerotic lesions.
